meanings.definition: Relating to the branch of biology that deals with fungi.
meanings.sent1: The mycological research lab was filled with various types of fungi under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: She decided to pursue a mycological career after discovering her fascination with mushrooms.
meanings.sent3: The mycological conference turned into a mushroom-themed party, complete with fungi-shaped decorations.
meanings.sent4: His mycological knowledge bloomed like mushrooms after a rainy day, spreading rapidly.
meanings.sent5: The mycological field trip allowed students to explore the hidden world of fungi in the forest.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the study of fungi.
meanings.sent1: The mycological textbook provided detailed information on different types of fungi.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use mycological techniques to identify and classify various fungi species.
meanings.sent3: The mycological club organized a mushroom foraging event in the woods for its members.
meanings.sent4: Her mycological expertise was as deep as the underground mycelium network of fungi.
meanings.sent5: The mycological exhibit at the museum showcased the beauty and diversity of fungi in nature.

meanings.definition: Involving or pertaining to the scientific study of fungi.
meanings.sent1: The mycological experiment aimed to understand the growth patterns of different fungi species.
meanings.sent2: Researchers published their mycological findings in a prestigious scientific journal.
meanings.sent3: The mycological investigation revealed a new species of fungi thriving in the damp forest.
meanings.sent4: His mycological observations were as precise as a microscope focusing on fungal spores.
meanings.sent5: The mycological symposium brought together experts from around the world to discuss fungi research.
